title.narrative: F.a: Building Strong and United Unions in Indonesia

description.narrative: IndustriALL has eleven affiliates in Indonesia, five in metal and mining sector. The metal sector unions have been in the forefront of creating strong trade union organizing culture in Indonesia and now this experience is intended to be broadened to the mi ning sector. The project activities concentrate primarily on organizing, training on collective bargaining, empowerment of women participation as well as joint lobbying on national level policy issues. The key problems for the project unions are weak organ izing, internal dispersion and low financial sustainability. For workers the key problems are low wages, low understanding of trade union movement as well as increase in the precarization of employment. Collective bargaining agreements are weak especially in multi-national companies and in securing equal rights for women workers. On national policy level, key joint challenges are occupational health and safety issues in mines (ILO176) and maternity protection (ILO183). The development objective is to ensure decent living and working conditions for workers in the metal and mining sectors.As a result of the project the membership of the project unions is expected to increase by 15 000 members. Unions will have efficient organizing strategies and a special focu s on organizing women and youth. The quantity, quality and coverage of collective bargaining agreements will increase and unions will have bargaining capacity also in gender issues. The participation of women will increase on all levels of union work – t he long-term target being at 40%. National level policy lobbying is efficient and advances the ratification of ILO Convention 176 and maternity protection. The main beneficiaries of the project are metal and mining sector unions, their members as well as t he unorganized workers of these sectors. The project partners are IndustiALL and its five affiliates in Indonesia; FSPMI and Lomenik in metal sector and KEP, CEMWU and FPE in the mining sector.
